models.name: mcp-github-pr-issue-analyser

models.name: sec2md
models.description: Convert SEC EDGAR filings, exhibits, and press releases to clean, LLM-ready Markdown. Page-aware. Section-aware. Table-preserving. Built for retrieval and reasoning.

models.name: Voice-Search-Enhancement-Using-LLMs
models.description: This repository aims to leverage new Large Language Models (LLMs) and concepts to enhance voice search, especially on e-commerce platforms. The primary focus is on the ability to extract relevant results based on long, conversational audio queries.

models.name: atuna
models.description: A Fine-tuning assistant for large language models

models.name: Farmio
models.description: We are developing a platform for renting farmland and farm tools, which leverages a local LLM (Large Language Model) to establish an AI-driven transaction system. The objective is to encourage more young people to take up farming.

models.name: ReleaseNotesRec-Agent
models.description: An AI-powered Release Notes & Feedback Analysis Agent built using LangChain, ChromaDB, and LLMs. It collects release notes, Reddit feedback, and real-world user issues, performs sentiment/topic analysis, and delivers accurate insights through a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) workflow.

models.name: llm-linguistic-alignment
models.description: This is an experimental implementation of the ALIGN package and is still a work in progress. This is NOT the official release. For the official ALIGN Python package, please visit: https://github.com/nickduran/align-linguistic-alignment. The official implementation is maintained by the original authors (Duran, Paxton, & Fusaroli).

models.name: release-notes-generator
models.description: This project automates the generation of consistent, structured, and audience-tailored release notes using Large Language Models (LLMs).

models.name: ISRO_EO_DATA

models.name: JamUpTaskMaster
models.description: A task manager utilitizng local LLMs that user can fire off rapid ideas without being overwhelmed with a todo list app. Made for neuroatypicals that need to just release building pressure of thoughts without an immediate "who what when where why" -- LLMs on a loop will kinda coax that out of you

models.name: Oris-Public
models.description: Initial public release of AI Assistant for home control of light. LLM still in development.

models.name: AI-Fake-News-Detection-system
models.description: This repository contains an AI-powered Fake News Detection System built using Python, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Machine Learning. The model classifies news articles as Real or Fake based on textual patterns.

models.name: Training-and-evaluating-cognitive-language-models
models.description: For training a cognitive language model with new datasets.

models.name: memfuse
models.description: MemFuse offers a robust memory layer for large language models, enhancing their performance and efficiency. Join our community on GitHub to explore features, report issues, or request new functionalities! üêôüíª

models.name: AI-Fake-News-Detector
models.description: This repository contains an AI-powered Fake News Detection System built using Python, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Machine Learning. The model classifies news articles as Real or Fake based on textual patterns.

models.name: AI-Fake-News-Detection-System-
models.description: This repository contains an AI-powered Fake News Detection System built using Python, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Machine Learning. The model classifies news articles as Real or Fake based on textual patterns.

models.name: opic
models.description: Event-based compositional language (self-hosting, self-compiling). Explore a new model of computation built on voices, chains, and cryptographic trust.

models.name: Fake-News-Detection
models.description: TruthGuard: AI-Powered Fake News Detection  A machine learning system designed to automatically classify news articles as real or fake using Natural Language Processing (NLP). The project features a dual-model approach and an interactive web application for easy demonstration and use.

models.name: Fake-news-
models.description: This project aims to detect whether a given news article is real or fake using Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning techniques. The model analyzes news headlines or article content to predict the authenticity of the news based on patterns learned from a labeled dataset.

models.name: llm-conditional-forget-codex
models.description: Humans can "conditionally forget" existing knowledge, such as rules in chess, and apply new hypothetical or analogical rules effectively, whereas large language models (LLMs) struggle to do this even with advanced reasoning capabilities. | Generated by Idea Explorer on 2025-11-06

models.name: Fake-News-Headline-Generator
models.description: The Fake News Headline Generator is an AI-based project that generates realistic and catchy fake news headlines using Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Deep Learning techniques. The goal of this project is to demonstrate how language models can create human-like text,and to raise awareness about the ease of generating misleading content online.

models.name: fake-news-detectors
models.description: The Fake News Detector is a machine learning project designed to classify news articles as ‚ÄúFake‚Äù or ‚ÄúTrue‚Äù based on their textual content. With the rise of misinformation across digital platforms, this model helps in automatically identifying unreliable news sources using Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques and classification algorithms.

models.name: Sign-Language-Detector-Translator
models.description: A Python-based sign language recognition project using MediaPipe and TensorFlow. Includes hand-tracking for data collection (cvzone + OpenCV) and real-time classification with a Keras model. Built for easy training, inference, and extension to new gestures.
